tasks.task: Harv Stevenson's mechanical thresher setup and operation
subtasks: Attach the mechanical thresher to the tractor
Position the front-end loader to feed grain into the thresher
Start the thresher and adjust settings for efficiency
Monitor the thresher operation, checking for impurities or blockages
Halt thresher operation and allow grain to settle
Use a pitchfork to transfer grain from the thresher to a storage bin or wagon
Dispose of the chaff or husk remaining in the thresher

tasks.task: Perform field operations with the tractor and thresher
subtasks: Navigate the tractor through the field, maintaining a steady speed
Apply minimal pressure to the accelerator, keeping fuel efficiency in mind
Guide the thresher's intake to encounter grain stalks properly
Keep an eye on the hay baler, adjusting rope tension or other settings if necessary
Oversee the overall harvest process, ensuring the thresher and tractor work smoothly together

tasks.task: Clean and maintain the mechanical thresher after use
subtasks: Remove mud and debris from the thresher's housing and moving parts
Lubricate moving parts as necessary to prevent wear
Inspect the thresher for any damage or required repairs before storing it
